ARABIC: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا ذَٰلِكَ رَجْعٌۢ بَعِيدٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When we are dead and turned to dust . . . ? That would be a most unlikely return!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When we are dead and turned to dust, this returning (to life) is most far-fetched."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: What! When we are dead and reduced to mere dust, (shall we be raised to life)? Such a return is far-fetched.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: that after we die and become dust, we shall be brought back to life again. This seems far from reality".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “When we are dead and have turned to dust, will we be raised again? That return is impossible!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: When we are dead and have become dust. (Shall we be resurrected) That is a far return."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: What! when we are dead and have become dust? That is afar (from probable) return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: What, when we are dead and become dust? That is a far returning!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: When we are dead and have become dust (shall we be brought back again)? That would be a far return!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: to come back to life after we have died and become dust? That is most improbable!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Shell We be brought back when we are dead and have become dust? That is a return remote!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: ‘What! When we are dead and have become dust, [shall we be raised again]? That is a far-fetched return!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: What! When we die and become dust, (shall we live again?) That is a (sort of) return far (from our understanding)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: When we are dead and have become dust (shall we be resurrected?) That is a far return."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: What, when we are dead and turned to dust? That indeed would be an unlikely return'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When we have died and become dust? This is a farfetched return.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: When we have died and have become dust, [we will return to life]? That is a distant return."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [50:3] What! (read a-idhā pronouncing both hamzas, or not pronouncing the second, but inserting an alif between the two in both cases) When we are dead and have become dust?, shall we return [to life]? That is a farfetched return!’, [an event that is] extremely remote.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (When we are dead and have become dust (shall we be brought back again)? That) which Muhammad claims (would be a far return!) will never happen; thus denying resurrection after death.
